title: Myanmar political violence
description: Myanmar is home to about 57 million. The British ruled the country (Burma) since 1820 and gained full independence in 1948, but since then civil wars have asphyxiated the country mostly due ethical conflicts and the struggle to balance power and the militias.

body_complment.text_wide: The map above visualizes reports of political violence in Myanmar this year from both, state forces and political militias clustered in a 10km-grid. The details below show areas with high activity, red for state forces and blue for militias.

Since 2010, ACLED has been documenting political violence in Myanmar; you can find out more about their reports and how they gather information about this country and other conflicts on their website.

title: The Afar Triangle
description: This year I was thinking to join the #30daymapchallenge. But time and procastination forced me to do brief appearances as a plan-B ðŸ˜…. The prompt for November 5th is â€™earthâ€™, so, hereâ€™s a map of the Afar Triangle.

body_complment.text_wide: Since I learned about this place, it easily captured my attention, the Afar Triangle is a depression in the great rift valley in eastern Africa. It has a triple junction of plates pulling in different directions, and a bunch more of curiosities. It's northern region is below 100m under the sea level, it's also the hottest place on Earth, (more then Death Valley yes) and it has hypersaline hot lakes.

I love to see the many geological features clashing into this place, many volcanic formations, plates pulling at different speeds and directions, rivers that evaporate, mountains and lakes everywhere... But tuns out that not all, the region is also home of the oldest human ancestor, Lucy who died and probably lived its life in the Afar Triangle some 3 million years ago. Here you have 2 more close-up details of the main map.

I'll try to post a few more maps to join the #30daymapchallenge of this year. I wish I can have a clone of my self to do more stuff!

title: Happy Birthday Costa Rica!
description:
This year Costa Rica turns 204 years of independence. My country is a little piece of land of about 51,100 square kilometers. However the seas sorounding it, make it a bit larger, about 589,600 square kilometers of maritime territory. That's about 11.5 times the size of the land area.
While browsing around, I came across this map showing tectonic plates and elevation profiles, and I thought it would be fun to make a 'terraced' version... so, here it is.

body_complment.text_wide: There has always been a great appreciation for nature conservation in Costa Rica, in fact, the country expanded the protected areas around the Cocos Island a few years ago. The move aims to protect this crucial corridor for many species in this region of the Pacific Ocean.

If you're curious about the source of the information, I got the contour profiles from Axismaps, and the rest is just Natural Earth and the original map I described above. I used QGIS to generate the base map, Blender to render the terrain and Adibe Illustrator for labels. Thanks for visiting my blog, and happy birthday, Costa Rica!.
